comment:
* FragmentManagerNonConfig stores the retained instance fragments across * activity recreation events. * *

Apps should treat objects of this type as opaque, returned by * and passed to the state save and restore process for fragments in * {@link FragmentController#retainNonConfig()} and * {@link FragmentController#restoreAllState(Parcelable, FragmentManagerNonConfig)}.

* * @deprecated Use the Support Library * {@link android.support.v4.app.FragmentManagerNonConfig}

methods.name: List<Fragment> getFragments()
methods.comment: * @return the retained instance fragments returned by a FragmentManager

methods.name: List<FragmentManagerNonConfig> getChildNonConfigs()
methods.comment: * @return the FragmentManagerNonConfigs from any applicable fragment's child FragmentManager
